intro: Ruellia rubra, commonly known as red ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright red or pink flowers that bloom from summer to fall. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while the stems are square and often hairy. Ruellia rubra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blossoms.
